means: 为混饭吃而粗制滥造的文艺作品，粗制作品作家（或画家）

sentence.Network_en: This is just another legal potboiler.
sentence.Network_cn: 这就是另一本法律题材的烂作。

list.abs: potbelly 大肚皮potboil 粗制滥造potboiler 粗制滥造作品

entry.tran: 为快速赚钱而粗制滥造的书籍（或电影）
entry.def: If you describe a book or film as a potboiler, you mean that it has been created in order to earn money quickly and is of poor quality.

means.word_mean: 1. a literary composition of poor quality that was written quickly to make money (to boil the pot)

auth_sentence.content: But despite the occasional hackneyed potboiler, this stuff works.
auth_sentence.res_content: But despite the occasional hackneyed potboiler, this stuff works.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But despite the occasional hackneyed potboiler, this stuff works.

auth_sentence.content: By now, just about every Presidential historian and potboiler-maker in the business has churned out a biography of Washington.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: By now, just about every Presidential historian and potboiler-maker in the business has churned out a biography of Washington.
